Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, handy for old town”
Reviews.Author: Arthur W
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good transfer from airport. Staff friendly and helpful. Limited menu at bistro but food quite good and excellently presented. Plenty of good Mexican restaurants nearby. Free wi fi. Room is good standard. Cons: pool not very accessible, no changing facilities. Didn't see it in use. Pricey for what is provided. Would be better with an inclusive self service type breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Quite noisy, but the staff are just great”
Reviews.Author: FC96
Reviews.Content: The staff make this hotel, they are extremely friendly and you will receive a truly warm welcome. It is quite noisy my room looks directly onto the freeway and I can hear my neighbors. Good vacation hotel, not so good for business.

Reviews.Title: “Dire”
Reviews.Author: Jimforever
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel if you want to get a good night's sleep. Internal noise from other rooms was a major issue as walls and floors are paper thin, and they clearly haven't heard of soft closing doors. There was a loud bang and the whole building shook whenever someone closed a door nearby (I was in room 267 in one of the annexes) and I was awoken at midnight with noise from family checking in to room nextdoor. Also toilet would not flush until maintenance called out, bed sheets were stained, and A/C was incredibly loud. In fairness, room was refurbished and visually appealing and bed seemed comfortable. The location is good and staff were friendly and as helpful as they could be given the limitations of the property. But not somewhere I would choose to check into again. For a slightly higher price, the Marriott Residence Inn in the Gaslamp district is infinitely superior.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Old Town”
Reviews.Author: rockedge
Reviews.Content: This property is in a great central location to visit San Diego. There are no views here,its more residential, but it's right next to the 5 and 805 freeways and two blocks from historic old town with great restaurants. It's a short hop to Sea World and Mission Bay with the tram close by and short drive to the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTING STAY”
Reviews.Author: treebilder
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very disappointed with our stay at your facility on the night of Monday, April 9, 2012. We stayed in Room 327, a ADA room with a wheel in shower. The following is our list of disappointments: 1) an air conditioner that was not effective, we set it for 68 degrees and it never got below about 74 2) the bed was way too soft 3) the water pressure in the shower was too weak barely coming out 4) the water did not drain from the shower floor. It pooled all night 5) the was rust on the grab bars weakening their strength 6) we purchased the executive plan where breakfast to be included. we never received anything that stated our choices where limited and yet we were billed for several items 7) the carpet had large stains 8) it appeared the bathroom was not cleaned - wiped down but not cleaned 9) toilet seat was loose 10) when my wife cancelled her breakfast selection because they wanted to bill us extra, we got attitude These were our initial observations

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: monica10171
Reviews.Content: Great location, can walk to everything in Old Town, right off of the highway (5). Perfect for heading to other areas of San Diego. Also the beds were the most comfortable ones we had of our whole stay. Staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to smuggle mattress out .”
Reviews.Author: KRich17
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay while in San Diego ...Old Town and bunch of resturants well within walking distance always felt very safe also. All of the usual tourist attraction within a very short drive. Nice hotel the beds are to die for get a "King". Didn't use much of the facility other than sleep. Very friendly would stay again for sure......Not a fan of the parking charge $15 a day but still a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DebKellaway
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. It felt like a very safe hotel. We especially liked the comfortable bed, the attractive decor of the room, the pleasant staff. It is close to Old Town and is convenient for touring San Diego. The sink and dressing area is a bit small, and was the only thing I would change. Good value considering the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with decent amenities”
Reviews.Author: TimoLV
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good deal so I decided to give it a try. I have never been a huge fan of the courtyard brand by Marriott as I am used to staying at the full line Marriotts and JW Marriott hotels but this hotel was nice. The hotel had been recently remodeled so it had a modern feel. The hotel is in old town so the decor is designed to blend into the neighborhood which was kind of charming. Overall this was a great value, I would stay here again. I would not, however pay full price due to the following factors: 1. The bathtub caulking was starting to mold - this is a carnal sin in the hospitality industry. Not good. Otherwise the bathtub was clean so I wish that they had gotten that detail. 2. The mattress was not as comfortable as it should be for a Marriott hotel. 3. The free coffee in the lobby was cold and only decaf was available. I am sure this would have been corrected upon request, but I was on the run.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and location”
Reviews.Author: kenefrank
Reviews.Content: Great staff and location. Free airport pick up and cruise transportation to port of San Diego. Also offered to pick up us no charge after the cruise for our after cruise stay. Within walking distance to Old Town and trolley station. Would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for an evening on the town....”
Reviews.Author: kdhillis
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay close to downtown San Diego so after our celebratory night out and dinner show, we stayed at the Old Town Courtyard. Saturday night, so parking in the building for the fee was worth it. We were upgraded to a suite which was a slightly strange one (window out to enclosed patio - could not see out or get out that way) and two pictures had been taken off the wall leaving holes. But it was still a Courtyard, very clean and comfortable (especially the bed). Our room was on the north end of the building, fourth floor, so very quiet; a few jets from airport in the morning. Hotel layout is a bit random and also a bit older. We walked two blocks into town for breakfast... All in All a comfortable stay....

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: scout303
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while my son was graduating from MCRD. When I booked this hotel, to be fair, they did say that it was under construction. I guess I wasn't prepared for the whole downstairs to be torn up. It was unfortunate that we didn't have a lobby to all sit down and get together. It looks like it will be very nice when it gets done. The location to Old town was outstanding. It was a couple of blocks walk to shops and restaurants. The rooms were fine and the staff was extremely helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky Choice”
Reviews.Author: JohnEric2
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay downtown but a convention took all the hotel space. We settled for the Courtyard in the Old Town and what a lucky choice. Firstly the Old Town with a vibrant night life is three minutes walk. The transit stop is 5 minutes walk and a $5 pass gives unlimited travel around this beautiful city. The rooms were up to the standard you would expect from this chain but a lot cheaper than downtown. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A building site - unfit to be open.”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_McM
Reviews.Content: I'm sure that it will be all sorted out in the end. But at the moment, this hotel is not fit to be open. It is in the middle of major building work, it is dirty, dusty, much of the main area is under construction as is much of the accommodation area, and the lift is being used by the contractors so it's dirty. The parts of the hotel that aren't under construction are tired. Courtyard is not a brand I use regularly but Ive always had good experiences. The staff were courteous, they must be having a terrible time. There was no fuss when I checked straight out again after seeing the extent of the horror.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Courtyard stay EVER”
Reviews.Author: gravitar
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for this hotel in July 2011. I had stayed at the hotel several times in the past few years and while it had not been updated to the new Marriott Courtyard standards, the property was "ok" and the service always excellent. I happened to check on the hotel website a week or so prior to our New Year's Weekend arrival and discovered that the hotel was undergoing a MAJOR renovation. Great for the hotel, bad for me. Had a received advance notice if this via email (they had all my contact information) I would have changed locations. 10 days prior to the stay on a holiday weekend that was no longer an option. Arrived at the hotel to find: Portable bar type unit as a front desk Portable bar as the bar, Temporary tables as the dining area All of this in an semi open type area with strip heaters on the ceiling. Had to walk through the "real" lobby that is totally torn up to get to the only working elevator. No temporary covering on the pathway to the elevator so dust everywhere Drywall dust and minor debris scattered in the guest corridor. Arrived at our suite (had been upgraded due to Marriott Rewards status. The room had a strong mold/mildew smell. My wife opened the drapes to see outside and discovered the room darkening shade was covered with mold. This room should not have been in service. They obviously don't actually inspect the rooms for potential health issues. Back to the front desk where we were moved to a standard room (was fine with that) that was newly renovated. Nice room but.. the new toilet leaked at the base and there were two lights in the bathroom that did not work. Not fixed during the two night stay. The stay was on a free night award (not points related). I was not going to complain about the situation but when the hotel pulled 20,000 from my wife's account in addition to using the free night certificate that was already attached to the reservation. Since I had to talk with Marriott to get the points refunded, I made them aware of the lack of notice about the construction and the service failures. In the resulting dialog with the property it became clear that they just don't care about guest satisfaction. Their response was an offhand "sorry" They are off my list of properties I stay at in SoCal. They should be off yours as well!

Reviews.Title: “Should be closed during major renovations!”
Reviews.Author: SkipperB
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at this property, and wanted to warn anyone planning on staying here in the very near future of the unfortunate experience we had. Normally if I book through Priceline, I feel I really can't gripe about what they give us..but it's a shame the Courtyard didn't opt to either lower their star rating (no way should it still be a 3 star property with major construction going on!) OR just close your doors for a short time while the main areas are a mess. The entire lobby is under construction with workers, dust, equipment, etc. greeting you right when you walk through the doors. They have a little temporary front desk set up off to the side. From there, you traipse through the work zone (the lobby is torn down to bare bones folks!) onto paint splattered carpet and dust to the elevator. We were on the 2nd floor and the room looked like a normal Courtyard room .. so I'm assuming it had been recently redecorated (from what I've read about the former outdated Southwest decor .. it looked nothing like that). It was small, but clean. There was a note on the desk mentioning the construction process starting at 8 am. Wrong! We were woken up each morning a little after 7 am, to the sounds of workers moving stuff around, setting things up (I guess?), clomping heavily on the floor above us, drilling and hammering on the ground floor below us, etc. It was noisy and we couldn't sleep. So much for our little vacation getaway in San Diego. I couldn't wait to leave. : ( I'm all for them sprucing up the place .. but for Courtyard to be selling rooms (at ANY price) while the hotel is anything BUT a restful, inviting place to spend the night is flat out horrible. The only positive was we had no problem finding parking on the street. (I have a feeling the only other guests there were Priceline-type bookings!) We honestly couldn't believe the hotel didn't even offer complimentary parking to compensate for the conditions. Shame on them.

Reviews.Title: “It's just okay..”
Reviews.Author: Sachingusain
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to airport and that was good. The hotel web site states that it has complimentary parking and when I checked in I was told to try and park off-street or pay for parking. The corridors were not clean, dim and were smelly. Room was just about okay. Was a little disappointed as I thought I had booked a mariott property. Hope the reconstruction changes it all.

Reviews.Title: “For a Courtyard, just OK”
Reviews.Author: Travelsaloth
Reviews.Content: We were using a free night and this was the closest hotel to where we were going that we could use. On the plus side, the front desk clerks (all shifts) were very nice and helpful. They were knowlegeable of the area and public transportation. The room was clean and quiet. The location was perfect for Old Town. Just a short walk to the main street. The lobby has a nice fireplace with seating. During the week they have a free wine and cheese happy hour. On the negative side, the room was very small and in need of an update. The only chair was the desk chair and there was hardly any room between the bed and the desk for it. Other Courtyards we have been in have been modern and spacious with a comfortable chair in addition to the desk chair. We felt very cramped. The bed was hard. Dining in the hotel is very expensive. Parking is $14 unless you want to find a place on the street. A cab ride to the downtown area (less than 5 miles) is approximately $20.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: tjg986
Reviews.Content: Arrived late and was given a room facing I-5. We called down to desk and was able to change the next day, and the front desk offered earplugs or a noise machine. The front desk staff was great. Very nice and helpful employees. After moving the next day we spent the next 3 nights in the front part of the hotel. It has been recently remodeled and you can still smell the new carpets. Room was spotless. The only complaint were the walls are paper thin. You can hear other rooms alarm clocks, toilets etc. Why do people insist on slamming doors at 5:00am. Not the hotels fault but just stupid people, not thinking of others. This happened every morning. The location is awesome we just walked everywhere including the train station. Old Town is a fun place that feels miles away from the city but yet so close with transit. Didn't have a car so can't coment on parking. What really shines here is the employees. Everyone is so friendly and willing to help. Thank you, its nice to get some good customer service. We will return

Reviews.Title: “Parking is convoluted and difficult”
Reviews.Author: mjbphx
Reviews.Content: There are 3 different parking garages on 3 different levels, each with only one way in and out. If you don't find a space (which are small and constrained by lots of pillars), then you have to back out, and try a different garage. At $14/night, it's your only choice if you're not early enough to grab one of the limited street spaces. I would rate the hotel in the bottom half of Courtyards I have stayed in. It is dated and tired (with mold on the ceiling of the shower, and bathroom tile grout needing cleaning). To the hotel's credit, a remodeling project is in process. Staff was very accommodating and friendly and I was lucky enough to get a room on the non-freeway side. It was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: BasilFowler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in October, as part of a Saga "Western Wonders" tour. The hotel was being worked on, painting etc but the work was being done during the day so did not disturb us at all. The room was very typical but clean and well equiped. A Coffee maker and Coffee was supplied. There is a VERY small outdoor pool with limited seating around. The Bar and Restaurant are small but OK. The hotel is well placed for exploring San Diego Old Town and there is a good selection of restaurants to choose from, many being Mexican type food but plenty of other choice including Steaks and Italian Pizza. If you want to go Downtown, there is a good trolley / tram service that goes from the station a short walk from the hotel. This runs every 20 minutes. We did not use it but were told by others that is was good, reliable and value for money. Parking at the hotel looks to be a nightmare. We did not have to worry as we were coach bound, but it appeared to have few spaces for guest cars compared to the number of rooms. Our first night was terrible due to noise from the next room. Lots of high pitched laughter, shouting and some swearing! At 03.30 a.m. we had had enough and called the front desk. There was no improvement by 04.00 so we called again. This time security was sent up and the noise ceased. Next day we were told that the occupants of the room had been turned out! I would recommend this hotel for only short breaks, one or two nights as the Old Town area can easily be explored in that tiome and after that you would need to travel Downtown for further exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Step back in time.”
Reviews.Author: mntgran
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this area of San Diego a lot. We were there visiting a niece in the Navy but the area offers a lot of good food, entertainment and sight seeing. Old town San Diego is with in walking distant. We suggest paying for the parking as it can be a bit of a problem in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Stay at Courtyard was excellent”
Reviews.Author: Rockoban
Reviews.Content: We flew in the day before our cruise and stayed at this fine establishment. Close enough to Old Town to walk to it. Room was nice. Food was good. The real nice part was that Courtyard picked us up at the airport and drove us to the port the next day for our cruise. The really best part was that they also picked us up at the dock when we disembarked and took us to the airport. What a neat and convenient service. Great for pre- or post-cruise stays.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, would stay again....however the hotel is being remodel.”
Reviews.Author: crussell02
Reviews.Content: Im a huge fan of Marriott hotels. I choose this location b/c of price and location. I had heard about old town but never stayed. I must say my sister, cousin and I really enjoyed ourselves. The hotel is 2blocks from the main street, that held the resturants and shops. we walked everywhere including to and from the trolley. The location gets a 5!!!! As for the hotel I would rate between a 3-4. The hotel is currently under construction. Mostly in the lobby, however specific remodeling projects are being implemented room by room. Our bathroom wall in the top corner and on the ceiling; was in need of repair. However, the rest of the room was fine. There is a fridge, coffee pot but no microwave. The hobby has free coffee and tea during the morning and lemon and cucumber slices favoring the water in the afternoon. Breakfast, lunch and i believe dinner is offered for a price ranging from $12-24. We chose to eat on the main street which offered much better deals as low as $5 for brkfast! The 3 goes to the pool area. It was dirty. In need of a good sweeping. The pool is fairly small but there is a jacuzzi. There is a parking fee if u park on premises. I believe it's 14 a day or something close to that. We choose to park on street for free. Our car was fine. Make sure you pay attention to the street signs, as to not get a ticket for parking in a limited time spot. We stayed for 3days and 2nights. The day and evening staff was extremely friendly and courteous. One in particular, I forget his name But he's of Asian descent, goes above and beyond to share value tips and suggestions on food and activities in the surrounding area. Oh and if you stay during the week; Taco Tuesday is a big hit!!!!! Mission and pacific beaches are 8-9mins away along with Sea World. Downtown San Diego is about 3-5min away depending on traffic. It's 1-3 min away from Hotel Circle. You can bike or ride the Trolley to and from many surrounding areas w/o driving your own car or even renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kativosk
Reviews.Content: The rooms and surrounding areas were clean, the pool was nice, and the location is great. Two blocks away are restaurants and shopping. The evening social hours (wine and cheese or ice cream) are well thought out, with a good variety of cheeses, crackers and wine. The help are attentive and polite. The only negative is that I had to keep getting my electronic room key replaced, which doesn't happen nearly this often at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel4fun3319
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June for a Sea World trip. The hotel is pretty dated and even smells old. We loved the location, though--walking distance to Old Town which was fabulous! My kids had fun in the hotel's pool (it's small, but kids don't care) and the breakfast buffet was pretty good. Parking is underground and very tight. I'm not sure if we'd stay here again. We really like to stay in Courtyard Marriotts and this one didn't measure up well to the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: wxchic007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 5 year old for one night while touring old town. Great location. You can walk to all the shops and restaurants from here. The hotel itself is old but very nice. The rooms are a bit dingy, but the beds were very comfortable. We didn't hear any noise from the freeway. The customer service was awesome! We got in around 1030am and they were able to check us in right away. Very nice staff here. The airport shuttle had to be called, but they showed up within 20mins and were very helpful. The only drawback was the pool. It was a little dirty and had some bird feathers. Other than that our stay was great! I would stay here again if visiting old town.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: IrishWife1
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard San Diego Old Town is lovely. The staff is nothing short of awesome! It's within walking distance to the shops, restaurants and bars of Old Town San Diego. Parking was easy - the hotel offers paid parking, but there was plenty of safe, free parking on the streets surrounding the Courtyard. We stayed for only one night - I wish it could have been longer. The room was very clean and comfortable - we had two double/queen beds, a small refrigerator, television, and free wifi; the bathroom suited us well (I was traveling with my sons) - the sink and vanity area were separated from the toilet and shower room. The shower/tub was very clean and the water pressure was great. The hotel has a laundry room with three washers and four driers - $1 to wash, $1 to dry, and laundry soap and fabric softener are provided free of charge. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but did enjoy the coffee that was available in the lobby and the bar staff was happy to provide wine glasses and a corkscrew for use in our room. I noticed computers in the lobby area for guest use. I would stay here again based on the friendliness and professionalism of the staff alone. Everything else was a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Conchliver123
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I decided to stay here anyway for two nights. First of all it was my husband and I and three children and my mom. They had only one room reservation. They then said they were sold out but couldn't refund the one room then magically found a room way down the hall it was a handicap room so we had only a shower. The rooms small as a closet. They brought up a roll away and I had to send it back because it couldn't fit. The location not so great. The highlight was this little Asian girl so very pleasant that worked in the Buffett.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok!”
Reviews.Author: daydreamer19
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 nights last month. We arrived on friday and enjoyed the ice cream sundaes! Wine & cheese are served monday-thursday. The hotel is a little dated and lighting in the halls are dim; but otherwise the rooms are good. I found the linens clean but worn. The pool was small and outdoor furniture needs refreshing. They have a nice lobby with free coffee and 3 computers for you to use. A nice stay but I really like the newer Coutyards!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: connieg33
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. Clean, convenient, very nice people. Walking distance to all of the Old Town shops & restaurants. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Staff was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: meeshnewyork
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to everything! Wine and cheese every evening except Friday when it is ice cream sundaes! The staff was extremely accommodating...no request went unmet. Bud, Lee and Michael were especially helpful. Definitely will stay again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good (except the freeway noise)”
Reviews.Author: QueenKat_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a short family break, and although the hotel is aging a little, overall it was in a great location, with good facilities and very helpful staff. Free ice cream on check-in will always be a winner with a 2 year old (and his Dad) - a very nice touch. The only downside is the noise from the freeway, which is very busy 24hrs a day. Just wish they could upgrade the windows to make this an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Old Town and the freeway!”
Reviews.Author: woodisgood
Reviews.Content: A very well maintained property. Elevators serve underground parking from lobby and rooms so is very convenient. Easily a 5-10 minute walk to everything in Old Town. The cookies at checkin were super good our first night but could not find any our other nights. Listen to the other reviewers, if you can't handle noise ask for a room in the front of the hotel. The freeway noise at the back, and to an extent, the sides of the hotel can be loud ( although he window do a decent job to dampen the noise). Certainly recommended though!

Reviews.Title: “Way Past Code Date”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaArchitect
Reviews.Content: "Courtyard by Marriott" immediately conjures up an image of clean, consistent, and efficient lodging. I go out of my way t stay in this brand of hotel. So when I checked into this Courtyard only to find out that my room wasn't ready at 10 PM. I have to wonder. I was then offered another room. After my hike there It hadn't been fully cleaned. I went back to the front counter and was told all we have is the handicapped room that is really noisy next to the freeway. They were right It was sure noisy. It was also only marginally clean. And in the morning when showering the shower drain didn't even remotely drain. Since it was the ADA room that means the whole toilet room was flooded. 20 minutes later as I left I snapped a photo. Nothing had exited the drain. All this for $200 a night! This property is way over due for a complete overhaul and upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, with some Fun Perks”
Reviews.Author: StephanieRose
Reviews.Content: I liked this property-I found the location to be convinient, rooms clean and comfortable, and everything else accommodating. For business and/or personal travel, I'd recommend it. If you are a light sleeper, make sure you ask for your room to be located facing away from the freeway as it can be a bit noisy. Other than that, I enjoyed the free wine and cheese. Some kids looked to enjoy the ice cream social as well. Convinient free shuttle to the airport and close to many San Diego attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: daf62757
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on our trip out to California. I had a business trip combined with a family vacation and we stayed here for 3 nights. The local area is fantastic. Wonderful Mexican food, shopping, and of course the perfect weather. The maid who did our room would fold my wife's grand kid's blankets (their personal blankets) each day. Most of the front desk staff were great except for one guy that seemed to have a lazy streak in him a mile wide. I requested he email my final bill and it never happened. When I called back, he said it was over a week and he couldn't. He found a way to say no.....and wouldn't lift his finger to help. But overall, a wonderful hotel that I will stay at again if I am in SD!

Reviews.Title: “A bit worn out, but the wine & cheese was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterIL
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located just steps from Old Town, is showing its age. There was chipped paint, stained carpets and industrial strength deodorizer in the air. The rooms are standard old-school Courtyard, but ours had an LCD and a nice, comfortable bed. The free wine and cheese reception was fantastic, but good wine free flowing for an hour and the friendly manager coming around to top off everyone's drinks before the hour was up. Nice touch. Despite others' enthusiasm over Old Town itself, we walked through it in about 20 minutes. There are tons of Mexican restaurants and stores selling overpriced junk with a southwest motif, but other than a few interesting museums (free) this was just not much of a destination. However, this hotel does offer rare airport shuttle service, and just four blocks away you can catch the light rail into downtown (we took it to and ate at Seaport Village), and it's also the starting point for the Trolley Tours, which go all over SD.

Reviews.Title: “My stay here was fine and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Reenactress
Reviews.Content: I am writing this to put some facts into the record as there are so many reviews posted that diss this place. I stayed two weekend nights in June when they were full. They promptly picked me up with their shuttle from the Amtrak station, saving me $15 cab fare. I had called them in the morning to ask them to block a room away from the freeway, after reading other posts about the noise. Certainly, while on the street walking to Old Town, the freeway noise is pervasive, so I appreciate those who posted that. Check in was prompt and the staff were helpful and friendly the entire stay. My room was clean and in good order. The bed had a variety of pillow firmnesses, and was covered in clean sheets with only one of those little footscarfs at the bottom of the bed. This is a Marriott standard, so don't know where the dirty bedspread comment could have come from. The mattress was not worn out. There was a large easy chair and it was in good repair. No stains, no worn out arms, no rips. There were 3 lamps, enuf to light the room. There was a pull out work table, lots of countertop in good repair, and an oversized luggage rack. The room does have the sink outside the bathroom, and this was clean and functional, but to my mind old fashioned, but I know a lot of people prefer that. The bathroom was clean and large. The shower curtain rod needed a screw tightened, and there was mold on the safety handle caulking, but none any where else in the bathroom. Good shower head, adjustable. I reported both those minor items for repair when I checked out. I did not need to adjust the room temperature, so I did not use the wall unit. These are not my favorite, and others had said they weren't fresh. As I had forgotten to pack most of my allergy medication, I didn't want to go there. I had no allergy problems in the room. i do think the hallway and room have that hotel cleaning fluid smell that you find a lot of place. The wallpaper, paint, furniture finishes etc were in good order except where the metal folding closet doors can gore the back of the bathroom door. There were dings there, but understandable. The color scheme will not win any prizes. It's blah. I always consider hotel room rugs to be dirty, and as it so happend, had needed to wash the slipper I take when traveling. As their soles did not get black there, I consider this rug to be less dirty than most. With a navy color, no other way to tell. No stains/spots, well vaccuumed. Staying only 1 night, with plenty of everything, I didn't have the maid come in at all, but as my room was clean, I suspect it's good. Large flatscreen TV with HBO, pretty standard channels. The breakfast was not overly pricey for a hotel breakfast, and as I was here on business, I didn't have time to hunt around for an alternative. Buffet selection was large: eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, biscuits and gravy, oatmeal, all the standard breads, yoghurts, fruits, juices. There was a guy to make you an omelet. The restaurant is dark and not attractively decorated but it was not the end of the world, especially for a quick breakfast. The location was good. It was literally a 2 block walk to the night life, dozens of restaurants and shops of Old Town, plus historic sights. It is 2 miles from USD, which is why I chose it. When my meetings ended early, they ran me to the Amtrak station specially so I could catch an earlier train home. Their regular run was a very close call for this particular train. Again, this saved me money. (They nornally shuttle to the airport and train station every hour on the hour) A friend came back with me for a drink one night, and we sat by the fireplace and chatted til she had to leave for dinner with her family. She found it nice and commented it was much better than where some other colleagues were staying. Cool weather and busy schedule meant no pool time for me, but lots of people were using it. I expect they will do some redecorating and polish this place up, but there is no reason to avoid it. I was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Old Town San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Jusbjen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my most favorite to stay in when I'm in San Diego. It's close to the airport, has ample free on-street parking and is within walking distance of some of the best restaurants the city has to offer. It's also perfectly situated in historic Old Town and only a short walk from the trolley that will take you all over the city. I'm a loyal Marriott customer and especially like the Courtyards with the free internet access and reasonably priced breakfast service but this particular hotel is high on my list as it is the complete package. Not to mention that the staff is always friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating desperately!”
Reviews.Author: HurricaneCarol
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights, and although the location is within walking distant of Old Town and some great Mexican Restaurants, until it is updated I would not choose to stay here again. The rooms have a mildew smell and the hallway carpeting had two big stains on the floor that we were on. It just wasn't up to Courtyard standards. The people at the front desk and the housekeeping staff could not have been friendlier, they were exceptional. I would recommend that Marriott put some money into this hotel and make it as nice as I have come to expect from the Courtyards I have stayed at in years past. We loved the Courtyard by Marriott San Diego Airport/Liberty Station, new, clean and updated, and I would recommend that one or I would stay at the Best Western in Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Quick and Easy”
Reviews.Author: dirtyriverdog
Reviews.Content: The main reason we decided to stay here was that it was less than 10 minutes to Sea World - The front desk even offers discounted admission tickets to the park. After we arrived we found out that the hotel was only 15 minutes to Coronado Island/Beach as well! Old Town historical disctrict is only a short walk away. There you will find numerous shops and restaurants. The staff - specifically Bailee, made our stay effortless.

Reviews.Title: “I was surprised by how disappointing this hotel was.”
Reviews.Author: RMA626
Reviews.Content: I know Marriott hotels. I'm an elite member, etc. I booked this hotel because I have an early flight out of San Diego tomorrow morning. I drove down from Orange County tonight in order to avoid a way too early start to tomorrow. The Good : -Close to San Diego airport. -Easy to find The Bad: -Parking is tight, and there's a charge, although free parking is available on the street. (I was not comfortable leaving my car on the street.) -Half of the rooms are literally on the freeway. I was given a room on the freeway - which i asked to change. There were other rooms available when I checked in. I'm actually surprised that the check in person didn't think that perhaps a gold member should get a better location. -The hotel smells - the hallways, and the room I'm in, but I'm not changing rooms again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: ROSEOC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located just a few blocks from old town main street and right off the 5 fwy. The hotel is clean and comfortable for the price. Downsides are no breakfast, only coffee in the lobby. You must pay for parking overnight which is highly advised due to the crime in the area. Major downside is the air conditiioning is not central and there is a very noisy wall unit. In addition, you have to listen to the neighbors wall units in the building so bring your ear plugs if you wish to get any sleep. Overall clean, decent for the price but you will not get quality sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a makeover!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSheryl
Reviews.Content: The location is nice but this hotel really needs a makeover. I turned on the AC in the room and it smelled like mildew......bedding and carpet are old. I got a room facing the freeway and it sounded like semis were driving thru!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: ntz4bbl
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at the Courtyard while attending a conference in San Diego. Overall, we were very happy with our room. It was very quiet and comfortable. We stayed in room 440 (top floor, end of hall). The only downside was the front desk when we checked in. We booked a package through Marriott that was to include breakfast, movie tickets, and Courtyard bucks. We had to call the front desk to find out about the movie tickets and bucks. When we checked out they realized we were never given our breakfast vouchers. Because of this we were given a credit on our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, complimentary shuttle but rooms need a MAKEOVER”
Reviews.Author: MimiLasVegasLasVEgas
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Diego on Friday 1/21 and the Hotel shuttle picked us up at the airport and let me check in at 9-am which was nice. I had called in advance and asked if they would accommodate the early check in and they said yes no problem. We arrived to find the outside of the hotel presentable and the front desk staff was very kind and helpful. However the room is OLD and the bedding is not what a Courtyard by Marriot should be. The air conditioner is the old fashioned model in the wall and didn't work very well. The location is nice because you can walk to several restaurants within minutes. Also the complimentary shuttle to the ZOO and cruise port were also appreciated. The shuttle drivers were very kind and informative about the area. We decided to eat their breakfast buffet which was pretty good for the money but the coffee was luke warm. Would I stay here again...sorry to say NO. Marriot if your reading this review "Please do your selves a favor and REMODEL your hotel rooms".

Reviews.Title: “Great location; old rooms and bad service at front”
Reviews.Author: valcarcejim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice. The good: great location and free shuttle to cruise terminal close by. The breakfast buffet was good; and the servers were very, very nice. The bad: The front desk is a disaster and young staff could care less. The rooms were not clean> Coffee still in maker; and in bathroom, it looked like the doors were about rust off the hinges. Second stay, room even worse and stunk like mold and discovered the heater was leaking. This hotel needs a makeover, starting at the front desk, and moving towards the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: DonPlatt
Reviews.Content: We travelled to San Diego for our grandson's graduation from Marine Corp Boot Camp and to relax for a few extra days. The front desk, the general manager, and the housekeeping staff treated us like family for the week we were there. We asked for a larger room so both of us could do some work and were accomodated without hesitation. The housekeeping staff found an extra table. the property was in excellent condition even though we understood they were going to do some renovation. It is two blocks to central old town. The restaurant and bar with the free evening happy hour was excellent. We would return to this property anytime we are back in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Elpasomom
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family over thanksgiving week. Was worried because of some of the reviews I read, but this hotel was absolutely fine-just what I expect from a Courtyard. It is right next to the interstate, but so are a lot of hotels in this area. The staff are very accomodating about requesting a room away from the traffic when you make your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - superb staff”
Reviews.Author: samcoronado
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend with my husband and was impressed with the level of service at this Courtyard. From the moment I walked in, to the moment I checked out, I was treated like a welcome guest. Every staff member I encountered during my stay acknowledged me with a smile and a greeting. Rooms were extremely clean and spotless. Nice touches included artful folding of the towels. a welcome gift from the hotel (I'm a Marriott Platinum), walking maps of Old Town, printed directions to San Diego attractions, and a welcome note from the hotel's General Manager. This Courtyard understands customer service and has obviously worked to make it a priority. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: meginla
Reviews.Content: I had to drive down to San Diego from LA for an overnight business trip. Hoped that my stay at the Courtyard was off to an excellent start when I called from the road and was warmly told they would hold the only room available at the time so I could check in early, change and get to my work event. However, I soon realized the room they had given me was a worn-down handicapped-accessible room and the deadbolt on the door had been ripped off the door itself. To add to the discomfort, the room was next to the elevator, soda machine AND faced the interstate. To say it was loud when I went to bed is an understatement. My true disappointment happened in the morning. I had been told I was booked on a corporate rate (which I felt was already overpriced for the hotel) and was surprised to see my bill under my door and that it was for a higher price. When I called downstairs and spoke to the desk manager, Victor, he could not have been less interested in my situation. Besides having to get past the language barrier since his English was not the best (in San Diego, mind you) he was not helpful at all. Not one bit. I was surprised that this is the way I was treated since I had been told a completely different rate when my contact booked the room. In addition, I went down for breakfast and had to ask for washcloth after sitting down because the menu and table were covered in syrup or something and it was sticky and gross ewww. I would not advise that anyone stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: MsEdnaMode
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and it was close to downtown San Diego and Sea World. Unfortunately, it is right next to the I-5, so it is extremely noisy. I did ask for a quiet room and the room was quiet in regards to the other hotel guests. But you will not get a good nights sleep without ear plugs. You pay $12/night to park in the underground garage. Not great, but from what I could see, if you park on the street, you are walking several blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: unicorngirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night only thankfully. It ha to be said it is in a great location, in walking distance from old town and a short drive to seaworld. But this doesn't give Marriott a licence to leave this hotel in such a state. Firstly the entrance and lobby are nice, with complimentary internet for guests which is great. But then you enter a tiny lift which smells of petrol? We then walked through the aged shabby corridor to our unbelievably low ceilinged room (I am 5"6 and could touch the ceiling with my arm outstretched). Then we spotted the earplugs (one set in a twin room - can anybody say stupid?) and though uh oh. We pulled back the curtains to reveal a busy and very very very noisy freeway. If you do stay here make sure to request a room that does not overlook this road, as it seems they will splash out on lcd tv's but not on soundproof glass. An effort has been made to modernise the rooms with the flashy tvs etc, but it is not enough, our room could have done with a complete overhaul rather than a tv. The hotel is very clean, just dated. I would not recommend staying here. Due to lack of sleep I would have gone crazy if the stay was longer than one night. Plus the fact they could not offer us a smoking room or a change in room.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but good location and good staff”
Reviews.Author: texastech
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, the property isn't great. The building seems a little old and tired, and didn't seem the cleanest. However, for the price, the place met my expectations. It is a great location with easy highway access and walkable to Old Town. The staff was excellent. There was a free wine and cheese reception when we arrived. There is an efficient courtesy shuttle system with friendly and prompt drivers. Parking is in secured, attached parking deck. Breakfast was pretty good. Major complaint is the lack of a thermostat on the heating/cooling system. It was difficult to regulate the temperature in the room. We did not face the freeway and had a quiet and pleasant room.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: dd992emo
Reviews.Content: I really love this place. Location is just superior. Walking distance to Old Town and the Trolley, which will get you just about anywhere. I asked for, and received, a room on the wing away from I-5, so freeway noise was not an issue.I spent 4 weeks here on business. My issues with them are fairly small things. Pro: - Location. Location. Location. - Beautiful facility. Great lobby. - Staff is very friendly. Young lady named Baylee on the front desk is a gem. - Nice exercise room. - Nice wine reception in the evenings. Con: - They cater functions to some fairly low-rent groups. Loud (and bad) bands, yelling and cursing late at night, etc. - Elevators out of commission more than you would expect. Winter rains leaked in badly and completely overwhelmed their elevator systems. - Lighting in the bathroom is really bad. Fluorescent fixtures they use are way too dim. I’ll continue to stay here whenever I have business in San Diego. It’s a really nice property with an excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful hotel, don't bother to stay there”
Reviews.Author: DGK65
Reviews.Content: I havd had stay many nights in the different Marriott properties, this is so far the worst place. 1) the place is old inside, 2) the room smells, 3) the room I got is face the high way, 4) the worst part is that window doesn't block any sound, so I couldn't get a good sleep because of hearing the noise from highway all night long. This place is worst than quality inn or similar places, more like a motel 6. I am not an usual complainer, and my trip is for business, not vacation (thanks god!), but this place is really falling out of my expectation too much. Whether you are on business or leisure, stay somewhere else unless you can sleep in the smell and noise room.

Reviews.Title: “Room smelled very bad.”
Reviews.Author: flying_about
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the fourth floor. This is an older building. There was a disgusting smell wafting into the room from the bathroom, most probably from old & leaking plumbing. The interior seems to have been renovated at one point, but rather superficially. In addition, it is beyond my comprehension how management and housekeeping can ignore how the bedskirts look. They were full of stains, and that did not just happen yesterday. Some of them looked like vomit or worse, and there was not just one. Utterly disgusting. Third: for the price of this hotel, why have to put up with such flimsy windows? In this day and age, soundproof windows actually exist, but Courtyard probably never heard of them, not even in technologically advanced San Diego. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Southwest Ambience in an efficient business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Songbird4JC
Reviews.Content: On the fourth (top) floor, my room has skylights and an enclosed lanai. The bathroom is tiny, but sufficient. It's Courtyard excellence with that old Spanish era flavor. Front desk staff are cheerful, helpful and respectful. Lobby area is a bit tight for a Courtyard, but it works well, anyway. The hotel is located right by the freeway and it's easy to get to places. However, unless you can find parking on the street, or are fortunate enough to grab one of the few spots right outside the lobby door, be ready to pay $12/night for parking in one of their garages. Unlike the Courtyard in Downtown San Diego, though, the interior insulation is like a Fairlfield Inn - not very effective in blocking out the sounds of someone scurrying down the hall or allowing their door to slam shut. There's an onsite restaurant that serves breakfast and dinner, but you can also walk to Old Town for dining. I would stay here again because the staff is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: peggymack
Reviews.Content: Oher Trip Advisor members recommended requesting a room away from the freeway. We did so and our room was very comfortable and quiet. The staff are very friendly and attentive. Although they charge $12 for secure parking, they did mention there were a number of places on the street to park for free. Because it was Christmas Eve and relatively quiet, we did park on the street right across from the hotel. This is a very short stroll to the Old Town. I would definitely stay here again. It's good value and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for old Town”
Reviews.Author: bognor
Reviews.Content: Quite decent hotel very convenient for the Old Town which should not be missed, especially at night. Room was fine apart from not having a safe which would have saved us having to cart passports etc. around with us. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: iblauralee
Reviews.Content: Was a little nervous to stay here after reading reviews. Made reservation for 3 nights. Hotel was really great. Requested room away from freeway so my room was very quiet. Looks like rooms and hotel recently renovated. Furniture in room was new and the carpet, wallpaper, and bathroom looked brand new also. Room had large flat screen tv, minifridge, and free internet. If you didn't bring your computer, there are 3 nice computers in lobby that you can use. Room was super clean. Hotel charges for parking but I received a special rate that included parking and breakfast (pays to be a Mariott rewards member). Parking in underground lots underneath hotel. Felt my car was safe and secure. Breakfast was ok. There is a buffet and your eggs and waffles are made to order. If I didn't have free coupon, would probably have eaten elsewhere. In the evenings, there is a bar onsite so you can order drinks and food. Pool is small but nice. Sign says pool has a 16 person maximum. Hotel is located 2 blocks from the outer edges of Old Town(near the Whaley House). The 2 block walk seemed a bit isolated and since I was a lone female traveler, did not walk over there. Hotel did sell tickets for the trolley tour. They were discounted tickets and I saved $4. Overall, I was extremely happy with hotel. Would definately stay there again. I travel and stay in hotels all the time. Definately a great place.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars is a bit mean but watch the highway noise”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in late June whilst attending a convention in downtown San Diego. Rate was $99 - $129 + tax (rate change in the stay) booked off the Marriott web site. Lets get the worries out of the way. This hotel is located next to a busy freeway. They do provide ear plugs - never a good sign. Our rooms were not too bad - on the side of the hotel towards the back the back. There was audible background freeway noise when I didn't have the aircon fan on. When I did the fan hum drowned out the freeway. I didn't have a problem with it and have stayed in a lot nosier hotels. Those with rooms overlooking the freeway may well have caused for complaint - watch your room selection. The rest is positive. The location is excellent a couple of blocks from Old Town and 5 mins walk from the trolley which takes you downtown. $2.50 one way, $5 for a day pass and $12 for a 3 day pass. With downtown hotels costing about double I'd recommend Old Town as a location to stay. Even the cab fare back late at night was only $16. Old Town itself is a pleasant location with plenty of bars, restaurants, etc. Thanks to Trip Advisor I parked on street - thus avoiding the nightly parking charge. However, BE WARNED, if parking on even the slightest down hill slant make sure your steering and therefore wheels are angled to the kerb. I didn't and the result was a $47 parking violation which, more or less, negated the street parking saving. Room was fine (standard Courtyard), free internet worked and they had a couple of internet connected PCs in the lobby which took USB keys with printers attached. Perfect. The exercise room had two joggers, two bikes and a X-trainer and free weights all in good working order. The pool is tiny and there is a nice veranda area. A nice touch is the free wine and cheese most evenings around 5:00pm in the lobby. Didn't eat in the hotel as Old Town is just up the road and has great choices for both breakfast and evening meals. Its a better choice than the Mission Valley hotels due to the proximity of Old Town and the trolley. So, in summary, I'd stay there again but be sure to arrange a room away from the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4_On_The_G0
Reviews.Content: Hotel is easy, walking distance to Old Town, 5 minutes to SeaWorld and 10 minutes to the Zoo. We enjoyed the parks during the day, then explored Old Town and sampled Old Town's restaurants in the evening. The staff was awesome! - registration desk, the room management and restaurant. Of course the registration staff were very friendly and helpful. They accurately had noted our request of beds including the roll away bed and room location (did not want to be by the elevator) and fulfilled these requests. Additionally , they know the area and gave great recommendations for restaurants and shops. The restaurant staff were prompt in their service with our special orders - all very friendly making our breakfast dining experience quick and pleasurable. The breakfast buffet and menu selections were very good. It was really returning after a full day of Amusement Park activities and walking into our very clean, comfortable room. And the roll away bed was comfortable and fit in the room with our 2 queen size beds without issue. We did check out the Fitness Center and thought we would use this feature in a future visit. Returning to the hotel one evening, we found a wedding reception in process - their reception was beautifully decorated then later noticed they large group had moved to a separate dining room - more great features of this hotel. I have spent ~ 20 years in business travel and know that I can depend on the Marriott hotels' high standard of guest comfort. Hence our choice of staying in the Courtyard. We are planning to stay at this hotel again when we return to San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: penelope1976
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel! Very centrally located to everything in San Diego! We were withing walking distance to the historic Old Town neighborhood. The beaches are a short drive away, and it is very close to downtown. The only downside was parking is $12 a day, but I've become used to paying to park in most cities. This hotel was very clean, and the staff was very friendly! A++++!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: 24pixels
Reviews.Content: You know you're in trouble when you arrive and there are ear plugs on the nightstand. The prime location directly next to hwy 5 meant it felt like you were sleeping on the hwy. The rooms were no more impressive than a motel 6. I can't understand why you would stay here with so many other choices in the area. We arrived very late after driving all day and just wanted to sleep - not the place to do that. Instead I'm awake writing this review thinking how much money I could have saved someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Old Town-comfy beds too!”
Reviews.Author: vwjettadriver1
Reviews.Content: We (my boyfriend and myself) stayed here two nights, Friday and Saturday. The hotel is a two block stroll from Old Town for meals and touristy things. We walked around during daytime and nightime. Nightime seemed sketchy (wouldn't walk alone) but we had no problems. The staff was vey friendly and helpful. Like everyone said the beds and pillows are awesome. Beautiful flat screen and nice desk area. Vanity area was a little small but workable. Very clean main room and bathroom too. Pool was nice and hot tub was great (didn't know conference room overlooked pool area-hope there were no Saturday meetings!) Close to airport, zoo and downtown. Great value and location. Seemed to be all families during our stay. Easy on and off the highway too. We would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average and smelly”
Reviews.Author: tink12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean but really stinky. The halls smelled like deviled eggs. Our toilet kept backing up and it just smelled gross the entire time--smelled really old and musty. Would not stay here again. It was loud with freeway noise too. The breakfast buffet was kind of gross to me and expensive. I thought it was FREE but I was wrong. Also, on our last day they still had not cleaned our room by 5pm. Anyway, not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel, VERY friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsClean76
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 day conference at the Old Town Mariott Courtyard. I had a conference rate of $159 per night for a king room. The hotel is older so there is some room noise - I could hear the guy in the room next to me coughing, and doors slamming in the hallway, but the rooms have been updated and are very nice except for the trim around doors and floor. The bed was supremely comfortable: it had a clean duvet instead of the usually icky bedspread and tons of pillows, both down and foam. There was a brand new looking 30" flat screen tv with a couple of HD channels. There is a very nice desk area with a great workspace, desk lamp, outlets for computer and cell phone right on the desk. This hotel had among the friendliest and most accomodating staff I have ever encountered! There was a free shuttle from the airport and a very courteous driver. I called the hotel when I landed and the shuttle arrived within 15 min. It saves about $15 in cab fare. I had a very early flight leaving and asked for a 5:00am shuttle that morning. The driver was in the lobby loading bags at 4:55am, and we left promptly at 5:00am. I asked for a 4:00am wakeup call, and got the call at exactly 4:00am. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. I was greeted every time I walked in the door or past the front desk, and asked if I needed anything. Tuesday night there is a host by the fireplace off the lobby serving complimentary wine, and there was a nice spead of cheese and crackers. Wednesday night the hostess served cookies and hot cider. I ate the in the hotel restaurant and our conference meals were catered by the hotel as well. Room service was fast and again the server was very polite and friendly. The food was fine, but if I hadn't been alone I would have walked to Old Town for dinner instead. The hotel is a block away from Old Town, so if that is your destination in San Diego, you can't beat this hotel. It is easily the nicest hotel near Old Town. The pool area was very small and right in clear view of the conference rooms, lobby, hotel restaurant and parking lot. I didn't use the pool because I would have had to swim in clear view of people sitting on the patio having business meetings and/or working on their laptops. I only saw one family while I was here - it was all business people so I probably wouldn't stay here during the week unless I was on business. It might be different on the weekend though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Centrally Located Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Louisville40204
Reviews.Content: Spent seven great days in the Courtyard Old Town San Diego, from Christmas Day to New Year's Day and had a fabulous stay. The hotel is very centrally located to all that is San Diego -- beaches, Sea World, Coronado, and, of course, Old Town, just to name a few areas! In fact, it is within walking distance of all Old Town attractions, as well as the trolley that runs throughout San Diego proper. The rooms are typical Courtyard and predictable (which I consider a good thing). However, the pool and hot tub are oddly located just outside from the front desk area, so you MUST go through the lobby to get to them, unless you would like to go outside and then re-enter. Either way, these are not really good options to getting to the pool/hot tub area. As other reviewers have mentioned, the parking is $12 per night if you choose to park with the hotel. However, street parking is typically not an issue, so I opted to park on the street and never failed to find a spot, regardless of the time of day or night. This property obviously did begin as a Courtyard, as is readily apparent upon arrival, but it does fit the Old Town look and feel. However, once inside, it truly does feel and look like the typical Courtyard. This particular neighborhood does seem a bit questionable at night, but I never encountered any problems, but on a few occasions there were older men just roaming around on the streets surrounding the property. Security does seem adequate at the hotel, as there was always a night guard on duty and the doors only accessible with a room key after 10 p.m. Bottom line...I would not hesitate to stay at this property again, but as many others have stressed, please request a room facing away from Interstate 5 -- quite busy and noisy if you are placed in one of those rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay... Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rawkneee
Reviews.Content: Location was great. My wife took me out here for my Birthday. We spent the day walking around Balboa, then took a short drive to our hotel and walked around Old Town San Diego, and crawled back to the room after a few bar visits. Old Town is two blocks away, easy to walk back and forth. At night we took a taxi to Canes restaurant which is in Mission Beach. Cab ride was only about $15. We had a car, but we were drinking and didn't want to worry about driving. The freeway off ramp is very close to this place, no getting lost. Rooms were clean and comfy, nice big TV, comfy bed. Not much luxury, just a basic room, but very clean and delightful. The following morning we headed out to a Chargers game. Qualcom stadium was a short 10 minute drive from here. Very satisfied with this hotel. Not too sure how much she paid for it, but I do know she booked it using Hotwire (I tought her well).

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EllieAZ
Reviews.Content: I guess my expectations were high considering San Diego's reputation, but the hotel was pretty dingy for my taste. Unfortunately it was fully booked so we couldn't switch rooms from the handicapped one we were assigned. No shower curtain or bath tub so the water spread through the bathroom floor and the toilet had a funny seat. Plus, the sink area was pretty cramped so I think it'd be hard for someone in a wheelchair to maneuver around. But, surprisingly, although we were in a room facing the highway, I didn't hear any noise and the sound of cars didn't wake me up. The location was pretty good--only a 5 minute car ride into downtown San Diego. Old Town wasn't that interesting but seemed safe. We took advantage of street parking at night so we didn't have to pay for the hotel's spaces. Definitely do this if you can--you'll save some $$. Overall, this hotel was one of the cheapest we could find during peak season, so I was satisfied, but I'll probably look into other options next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: skycathedral
Reviews.Content: This hotel was comfortable and clean. Lots of space and everything you needed. The only problem was that they didn't clean the room when we went out. We were lucky to get street parking each day, but if we had parked in the garage, they would have charged 15 dollars a day.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: KITTENSMOM
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with out seeing any pictures or reading any reviews. After I read the reviews this place sounded great. Getting there was very easy to find. It is with in 2 blocks of old town and shopping. I ate in the hotel restrant once for breakfast and it was not very good, I waited 30 min for french toast, I would not eat there again, The beds were very comfortable nice to sleep in. Yes we also had a freeway view we just keep the vent on all night and we did not hear the freeway at all. I would stay here again and recomned this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Freeway Noise”
Reviews.Author: bjrny
Reviews.Content: When my husband booked our room a month in advance, he asked that we be placed in a room that was not on the freeway side. So what room did they give us? Exactly. And when we asked to be moved, we were told that it was not possible. Thank goodness I went and asked another desk clerk and after 2 sleepless nights we were able to move. On the plus side, wine and cheese were offered on Mon, Tues and Wed from 4:30 to 5:30.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, walking distance to Old Town!!”
Reviews.Author: goldbear88
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a place to stay during the Rock n Roll Marathon San Diego...I found few places available in downtown San Diego, so i opted to try something close to Old Town even though it seemed a little distant from the marathon course. Turns out that I made a wise decision as Old Town is a great attraction! Various Mexican restaurants, close to the trolley, away from congested downtown!! And this became evident after the end of the marathon when thousands of people were in line for the trolley to downtown San Diego and there was no line for the trolley to Old Town!! The hotel itself was clean, the staff was great-they responded to my requests rather quickly, the pool was rather small but it was heated, free internet, free morning coffee! There was ample parking around the hotel so I avoided paying hotel parking fees. Skip the hotel restaurant and go to Coyote Cafe in Old Town! Great food, great atmosphere!!! I would stay again here if I travel back to San Diego...however, I would ask for a room away from the highway!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: glandsb500
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided we needed a break from the chores of daily life and we got it at this hotel. OK, so it was not the best hotel in San Diego, but it sure has a great location. We had a rental car so we were not dependent on public transport. Our room was typical of a Marriott Courtyard, very comfortable and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were within walking distance of all the pubs and restaurants of Olde Town. We had breakfast one morning and it was very good - buffet style. One small complaint - the bathroom area in the room is a bit cramped - OK for a single person staying in the room but not really large enough to cater for 2 people's toothbrushes, lotions and such like. Parking in San Diego is at a premium and the hotel charges $15/night to park. We managed to find parking on the street so it was not a problem. I would recommend this hotel for location and comfort. Not bad for it's price as hotels in San Diego can be very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Old Town”
Reviews.Author: DarlasDad
Reviews.Content: A typical Courtyard, though with a southern California flavor. The big plus is the short walk to the sights and eateries in Old Town - love that Cafe Coyote! It is right alongside 'the' I-5, so you may want to opt for the quieter side street rooms. The open-air breakfast area is nice if it isn't too chilly outside. Oddly enough, one of the memorable parts of our trip involved the cleaning staff. Early one morning, we were waiting in the garage for the elevator and when the door opened, what seemed like 50 (there had to be at least 20!) giggling little Hispanic women came running out. It was like the scenes of endless clowns emerging from the back seat of a car. Very funny at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: GEOFFS3
Reviews.Content: I paid $189 for a room that definetly wasn't worth it! It's a standard Marriott Courtyard room, just like you would expect anywhere else...just a little pricier! It's all about location, location, location. Indeed, this is a great spot to stay in. It's very central and there are many bars/restaurants you can walk to. The staff was very nice and accomodating I must say. Be forewarned, they do charge $15 for parking, unless you want to try and find street parking.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: weallgoforhugo
Reviews.Content: It's all about location. Pros: It's within walking distance to Old Town. Cons: I booked this room on Priceline for $50. I imagine this is why they put us in a room facing the highway -- the hotel backs up to an onramp for I-5, so it can be noisy. They also tried to charge us $15 daily for parking (perhaps this wouldn't apply to those who booked elsewhere). We opted to park on the street. During the week, do not park on the side of the street with the grade school, as they do ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LGPITT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and had a great time. The location was great - close to airport, walk to restuarants and trolley. The staff members were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were clean, bed comfortable and spacious. In old town, if you like Tequila, El Agave has a huge selection and excellent Margaritas. Also, the food at Cafe Coyote was extremely good. Both of these places were within walking distance. Overall, we liked Old Town and the hotel was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth $189/night”
Reviews.Author: cherylfabry
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Nov. 7-9 for convention held at hotel. Checked in at 8:30pm and got a handicap room facing the highway traffic (highway is less than 100 yards away from window). Asked to be moved but was told by rude front desk clerk that hotel was sold out - end of story. I went down to the front desk and spoke personnally to the manager who was very friendly and said he could move me next day. New room was on other side of hotel with standard room amenities. Although the room was definitely not worth $189/night, it would be worth less if you got a deal on priceline (like the other reviewer who paid $65/night). Beds have no support (old), room is heated/cooled by a window/floor unit (no central heat or air), carpet appears new, room was clean and appears to have been recently updated. Exercise room is located off hotel in parking garage. 2 treadmills, one elliptical, 2 stationary bikes, one weight bench and various weights - TV. Very crowded during work week between 5:30am and 7:00am. Hotel is walking distance from Old Town. Highly recommend Zocalo's for dinner - Spanish twist on favorites - but skip the Mojito - tasted like club soda. Skip restaurant Cafe Coyote - food is tired Mexican fare, not exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AmberNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September for 3 nights and were very disappointed. With a family of four the room was very small and there was not a lot of room for our bags. Luckily we were facing the carpark and it was very quiet. Plenty of off street parking so avoided a parking fee. The only advantage to this hotel was it was very close to Old Town and to the lovely restaurants there. The pool is situated next to an outdoor seating area and not very private. I would not recommend this hotel to families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: Angelfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Courtyard Old Town on Friday 10/19. I paid a total of $65 and some change through priceline. For the price, this place was a steal. Nice room with comfortable king bed with a view facing Old Town. Arrived via amtrak so parking was not an issue. But it did appear to be ample street parking if you arrive early enough. I would stay here again in a heartbeat if i could get the same price, but I would not pay the regular rates of $180 plus a night with aaa discount.

Reviews.Title: “Mixing Business With Pleasure Together”
Reviews.Author: mxnbsnswthplsr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights and enjoyed the hotel and its ammenities a lot. Our room was a king suite, on the 3rd floor, one window facing the pool and one window facing the side street toward Old Town. We did not hear any traffic noise. It was very quite and clean, the room was very spacious. It had a nice sink, huge counter, refridgerator and microwave. The king bed was very comfortable. The internet connection was a little slow but not 15 minutes, more like 2 or 3. The lobby was nicely appointed, with a nice fireplace and big easy chairs, the wine and cheese hour was really nice. The pool and spa was enjoyable although we agreed that access to it was a little odd. The restaurant was pretty good, we ate a late dinner and breakfast there and enjoyed both. The front desk staff was very helpful and pleasant. The parking garages were convenient, but a little tight on space. Oh, and thanks for the free Otis Spunkmeyer cookies and Seattles Best coffee located just off the lobby, they hit the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey”
Reviews.Author: TwoVacationLovers
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I booked a room here for one night in Oct. and just let me start by saying the young Guy at the desk who checked us in was very, very nice, helpful, Respectful and even upgraded us to a suite, We were coming back from a 4 Day Cruise to Mexico and wanted to stay in Old Town San Diego for a fifth night before flying back home to Northern Calif. I did look at this property online before booking and it seemed fine, however, Interstate 5 runs right behind the Property and even though we requested a room facing the front, we could still hear the noise all night long, in addition to that we were on a Romantic Trip and realized shortly after we got there that this is a very nice property for Business Executive's, not Romance, our suite even had a conference table! like I said very nice property for Business Executive's, nice business room's & suite's, but not for quite Romantic evening's

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: LuverOfTraveling
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stay at this hotel for the weekend, and were pretty disappointed about a few things we encountered. Like many people say, the noise from I-5 Freeway is pretty loud if you have a room that faces the road. It took over 15 minutes just to access their high-speed internet service, which was more like slow-speed; even times were we couldn't log on due to their connection. The price was $189 plus tax per night, was not worth it, and no breakfast was offered with this room. We had a better overall experience at the La Quinta Inn next door, and also, my boyfriend has stayed at the Holiday Inn Express just up the street; try those hotels first.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and comfortable, very nice!”
Reviews.Author: phazerbro
Reviews.Content: I was here for 4 days on business the last week of September, but I had plenty of time to enjoy the area too. This Marriott is a little smaller than some .. in fact I think it started life as a Holiday Inn years ago. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. And the entire hotel was in very good shape, nicely appointed and well kept. I had a small king room on the top (3rd) floor facing north. The freeway was in sight out my window, but the noise was almost non-existent. In fact the room was very quiet even with neighbors occupying rooms on both sides of mine. The room was roomy even though it was one of the smaller ones. It had a desk space and large overstuffed chair & ottoman for reading and relaxing too. The AC unit was quieter than many I've experienced, but it seemed to stay on forever. Not a lot of channels on TV but they do have the movies you can pay for & watch. There are several computers with free internet access in the lobby. The breakfast area was like a small restaurant which doubled as their cocktail lounge in the evening, and they had a covered outdoor patio which I used for every meal I ate there. The lobby had a nice assortment of chairs and couches, and every evening from 4:30 to 5:30 they had a free wine and cheese social hour which I took advantage of too. They have several meeting rooms so be prepared to deal with the inevitable groups that hold seminars & meetings here. The pool was small but nice .. however access to the pool was odd. The only way to the pool was thru the lobby, and then thru the restaurant or the outdoor patio and past the meeting rooms. So one would have to tromp by dozens of people to get to the pool. The patio was in use much of the day by a business group, so hardly anyone used the pool during those times. hmmm , not much else to complain about .... my room had a very small counter space next to the bathroom sink... It's two easy blocks to the heart of Old Town, and I ate dinner up there several nights. I recommend a restaurant called Zocalo's .
