Cheerful, airy, great food & service, eat inside or out, nice lounge area. This Marriott was a comfortable place, I would stay here again in a heartbeat ...

Reviews.Title: “The place for families and friends”
Reviews.Author: Minnx
Reviews.Content: A well maintained facility with brilliant staff who are highly attentive and professional Great location for Old Town shops and resturants, and a place to take the "hop on and off" Trolley tours. Easy to find location alongside the North South freeway, though we would expect the freeway side rooms to be noisier than the one were in which overlooks the main entrance. Secure underground parking from adjoining street and main driveway Great breakfast selection and quality. Fine dinners in a limited menu selection. Cocktails especially welcomed by the ladies !! Nice gym and small family pool Good free Internet facilities, including laser printer Overall an ideal location base for exploring sunny San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gomore
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a nice hotel for the price we paid with Priceline. The breakfast buffet was pricey, but great food with good selection. We had no problems with noise from the freeway traffic because we were in the building across from the lobby. The front desk staff was very friendly and we liked the internet access available in the lobby. Convenient shuttle service from the airport too! We found a parking place on the street so we avoided the $15 parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great tourist location”
Reviews.Author: tomcat33333
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Courtyard Old Town is its location, on the edge of Old Town San Diego. Once you figure out where it is, it's easy to get from the hotel to anything in Old Town. And because Old Town is served by San Diego's trolleys, it's easy to get to many other places in the city. The hotel is crammed onto a small space -- land is at a premium in Old Town. You can park in their garage for $15 or compete for a small number of free spaces in a tiny lot or go for on-street parking. We found it relatively easy to avoid paying for parking and would advise you at least try to do the same. The lobby contains all the tourist maps you could hope for. What''s more. the front desk was most helpful with directions. We did not try the restaurant for breakfast, but it looked like the same sort of buffet spread available in lots of hotels. There is a small pool that did not seem to be heated and a hot tub that comfortably seats 8 or so. And there's nothing lukewarm about the hot tub. Strong jets pushing lots of hot water. The rooms are comfortable, although the layout s somewhat old. We thought the beds felt soft until we actually climbed in. They were fine. The room was very clean. In sum, it's not the newest Couryard we've seen, nor is it the most covenient. But for a San Diego tourism experience, it's a fine choice, especially if you can book it about $160, as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Little Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Millyj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a little weekend getaway from Los Angeles with my husband and daughter. Not bad. Not bad area as well. In old town, near good dining and a walk thru the old town. A nice sized pool with jacuzzi that my daughter and I took full advantage of. Overall it's not a bad place to stay. Beds were a bit hard but then again it is the courtyard...

Reviews.Title: “good old time in old town”
Reviews.Author: vin
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the courtyard on a busy weekend in may. did not book, turned up on the doorstep and got a room. desk clerk Cameron sorted us out. we knew it would be expensive $190 per night. but what the heck we were on holiday.and £ for $$ good for us. nice room, big bed and even bigger chair facing into town, not the i-5.nice and quiet. breakfast included, full hot cooked to order. friday evening wine reception. small pool ,did not try. really enjoyed our stay there. a nice walk to old town park,shops and restaurants. tip use the trolly $30 p/p get on and off all day excellent thank you Cameron for your help.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MDTravelerrrr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from spending two nights at the Old Town Courtyard by Marriott in San Diego. We usually find this chain to provide a fair and comfortable facility. Unfortunately, this is not the case in San Diego. Not only is the facility old and somewhat rundown, it is uncomfortable (except for the bed) with the rooms being unusually small and inconvenient.....especially the bathrooms...and noisy. There is NO included breakfast and the internet service in the lobby is only available at a very excessive cost. We stayed there because we needed airport transportation and even that was delayed from its schedule with no apology or apparent reason. We will NOT stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of I-5”
Reviews.Author: ButIDigress
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to Old Town and the staff is friendly and the Manager was very accomodating. The breakfast staff polite but when I'm given a hand-written receipt of my meal with Total:, Tax:, Tip: all hand written on a register paper I get a little suspicious. Is my money really being put in the register? I would have had a terrible stay if the front desk had not moved me on my arrival. My first room was facing an onramp of I-5 and after the second motorcycle roared on the ramp and onto I-5 I looked outside and the highway was 30 feet from the building. No sound proofing of any kind except for the thick vinyl curtain over the window. I thought I was over the highway the noise was so loud from trucks, etc. going to LA. Once I got moved to the front of the hotel overlooking the registration area it was a very pleasant place. I just felt so sorry for later arrivals facing the back rooms. If I went back to Old Town I'd stay in the Holiday Inn Express up the street. I don't know about the rooms there but I don't think any of their rooms are on the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, great location”
Reviews.Author: Barrysentials
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel that is in a great location -- two blocks from touristy/schlocky Old Town, five minutes from Mission Bay and Sea World and ten minutes from Balboa Park. Thanks to other reviews, I knew to stay away from the side close to the freeway and I must say that I did not hear any traffic noise at all. I was by the elevator and I didn't hear that either. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Had a very minor problem with my room phone and I got a very nice email from the manager a day later. The hotel was spotless and they had a nice fire going in the lobby fireplace. They offer free internet services in room, which is a plus. The room was nicely furnished and adequately sized. The bed was really comfortable and the shower was nice too. The sink area is outside the room with the toilet and the shower, but it was a little cramped. Plenty of towels and pillows. I didn't get a chance to eat in the hotel. The pool looks fairly small, and the tiny exercise room has a bike, treadmill, eliptical trainer, single weight machine, tv, a/c and water cooler. As other people noted, there is plenty of street parking and about 10 free spots on the hotel grounds so you can avoid the $15 parking fee. The hotel is a bit pricey, but I think that's the nature of the area. In comparison to what other places are going for in the nearby areas, it seems reasonable. For what it is, it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent San Diego Option”
Reviews.Author: GraftonTraveler24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights after abandoning Humphrey's Half Moon Inn. We did not have a reservation but the staff was friendly and helpful as they rearranged other shorter stays to accomodate us. The room was excellent. It was clean and neat with a king bed. Our room overlooked the pool. Try to get a room away from the highway. The hotel restaurant had an excellent breakfast buffet. The location was great for exploring Old Town and central for the whole city with easy highway connections and it's not too far from the trolley. Overall, we were pleasantly surprised after leaving our original hotel. We would stay hear again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “OK but get a room away from freeway side”
Reviews.Author: UKUK-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for two nights at the Courtyard... Initially booked into a room overlooking the Freeway - the noise was as if the windows were open. Complained in the middle of the night because I just couldn't sleep. Promised that our room would be changed for a quieter one the following day. This was duly done and the noise reduction was remarkable - just moving from one side of the hallway to the other. Hotel on the whole was OK for a large chain - expensive for the facilities on offer so just OK

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Treeless
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Courtyard! We had a problem at the beginning with workmen already staying in our room. The front desk girl forgot to properly check them in so we got a surprise when we opened the door. The asst. mgr. was very apologetic as was the front desk girl. He quickly put us in another room and did not charge us the $15 per day parking fee. We stayed 3 days so we saved $45. The room and bed were very clean and comfortable. The first day we asked to have the room cleaned by 3 pm so we could take a nap and it was cleaned. The second day we forgot to ask and the maid came in just as we got back in the room. She apologized for being late but said she had lots of rooms to clean. She hurriedly cleaned up and gave us a happy new year card and thanked us for our patience. We ate the breakfast buffet all 3 mornings and it was very good! Eggs cooked to order or omelet or scrambled, potatoes, sausage, bacon, fruit, waffles, toast, bagels, oatmeal, yogurt. Parking underneath the hotel was designed for small cars and was cramped. It was difficult parking and getting out. Overall we enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: rihoward
Reviews.Content: What a really nice hotel; can't think of any downsides apart from a slight smell of cigarette smoke in the hall - 2 minute walk to the Old Town Main Street, a 5/10 minute drive to SeaWorld and 10 minutes to the Gas Lamp. - Safe street parking around the hotel- no need to valet park, unlike most other hotels in San Diego - Cameron at reception- great local knowledge. - Steve in the bar- only works two days a week but should have his own bar instead of working here- worth staying in the hotel bar for the conversation alone. - great buffet breakfast (fresh fruit, bagels, omlettes, sausages, eggs etc. - Large clean rooms - Free coffee and cookies (with real milk) - Excellent value. Prior to staying here, I had stayed in town in the Westin Horton Plaza for three nights ($100 dollars more expensive.....a good hotel in its own right but not worth the extra money compared to a hotel where they know your name after a day or so) We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: quakerquisp
Reviews.Content: looks exactly as pictured we had room w/2 queen beds(yes queen) very clean,beds comfy, shower fine, not much room on bathroom counter you could move the coffee pot. Right when you walk in to the right is the bathroom door if open you can hit it behind that is a mirrored closet. Secure parking is 15.00 need a key card for gate. Everyone very nice and friendly. Old Town is a 5 minute walk. Coyote Cantina very good food. Did not eat at hotel(Rickys at hotel circle very good breakfast and lunch) Would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard San Diego Old Town
HotelInfo.Address: 2435 Jefferson Street, San Diego, CA 92110
